## Wondering what is this simple animation above?,

*Well that is a very interesting story for those who like experimenting without limits...*:

### *"2021, I started to pickup some interesting things happening in the coding world right before the bootcamp... we are not bound to only Flash animations anymore"*

While I was getting back to the basics of HTML and CSS, I stumbled across some youtube video about people animating SVGs with CSS and I was like: *"That is super Cool!!!"*.
I started watching one after the other all sorts of quick tutorials and it all sounded so simple and interesting.

Finally I discovered [Developed by Ed](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gWai7fYp9PY&t=58s)
<div className="flex items-center justify-center w-full">
  <Image src="https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/31110235?v=4" className="rounded-full" width={250} height={250} />
</div>
He was so chill, funny and interesting to watch, he was explaining how to animate SVGs with CSS and I was like: *"I can do that!"*.

Using his example I reproduced exactly the same thing. Not satisfied I dive deeper and tried to make things more complex...
Since I already spotted [Le Wagon](https://www.lewagon.com/) bootcamp, I decided to try to reproduce their logo and animate it using CSS and SVGs.
Took me some minutes to get my hand on but quickly I made it. I was so happy and proud of myself.
But wait... it was not nice enough making it jump up and down, I wanted to make it more interesting... what about a wagon on a road?

This was so much fun, I was so proud that I started sharing my accomplishments around me. I even sent to the Director of the bootcamp as I wanted to embark on this journey with them.

In the quest of discovering more I found [Cassie](http://www.cassie.codes)... her website is a golden mine in the world of SVGs and animations. I was so impressed by her work that I decided to try to reproduce one of her SVGs.
Creating my own animated text logo!

Well it was not that great expected result in the end after a lot of struggle...

However I was learning more 1% better than the day before! And believe me... this was quite satisfactory.
In the end I was able to get enough knowledge to create my own animated logo, background and designs... It was useful enough for me to use it at work on our new homepage 2 days ago ( Now I am just waiting for it to be review and deploy to prod)
